member.name: T:HelixToolkit.QuadVisual3D
member.summary:
A quadrilateral defined by the four corner points.
Point4 Point3 +---------------+ | | | | +---------------+ Point1 Point2
The texture coordinates are (0,0) (1,0) +---------------+ | | | | +---------------+ (0,1) (1,1)

member.name: M:HelixToolkit.StereoHelper.CalculateStereoBase(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate the stereo base using the full Bercovitz formula
member.param: Largest distance from the camera lens
Nearest distance from the camera lens

member.name: M:HelixToolkit.StereoHelper.CalculateStereoBase(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate the stereo base using the full Bercovitz formula B = P(LN/(L-N)) (1/F - (L+N)/2LN) http://nzphoto.tripod.com/stereo/3dtake/fbercowitz.htm
member.param: Parallax aimed for, in mm on the film
Largest distance from the camera lens, mm
Nearest distance from the camera lens, mm
Focal length of the lens, mm

member.summary: Updates the left and right camera based on a center camera.
member.param: true for cross-viewingm false for parallel-viewing
use the same UpDirection for both cameras
use the same LookDirection for both cameras

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.GradientBrushes

member.name: M:HelixToolkit.Polygon.Triangulate
member.summary: Triangulate by cutting ears

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.CuttingEarsTriangulator
member.summary:
Cutting ears triangulator for simple polygons (no holes) O(n^2) Based on http://www.flipcode.com/archives/Efficient_Polygon_Triangulation.shtml
References http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polygon_triangulation http://computacion.cs.cinvestav.mx/~anzures/geom/triangulation.php http://www.codeproject.com/KB/recipes/cspolygontriangulation.aspx

member.name: M:HelixToolkit.CuttingEarsTriangulator.Triangulate(System.Windows.Media.PointCollection)
member.summary: Triangulate a polygon (cutting ears algorithm) The algorithm does not support holes.

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.TruncatedConeVisual3D
member.summary: A truncated cone defined by Origin, Height, Normal, Base- and TopRadius

member.param: Delta time since last call of OnAnimationTick (seconds)

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.OpacitySortingVisual3D
member.summary: This is a ModelVisual3D where the child Model3Ds are sorted by opacity. Opaque models are added first, then transparent models at decreasing distance from camera.

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.VrmlExporter

Export the visual tree to a VRML97 (2.0) file http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vrml http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web3D
VRML plugin/browser detector: http://cic.nist.gov/vrml/vbdetect.html
Links http://openvrml.org/

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.TerrainVisual3D
member.summary: Terrain model - reading model from .bt files The origin of model will be centered around the midpoint of the model. Also support a ".btz" format - compressed with gzip. A compression method to convert from ".bt" to ".btz" can be found in the GZipHelper. No advanced LOD algorithm imported - this is for small terrains only...

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.MapTexture
member.summary: Terrain texture using a bitmap. Set the Left,Right,Bottom and Top coordinates to get the right alignment.

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.HelixVisual3D
member.summary: The HelixVisual3D renders a Helix. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helix A helix (pl: helixes or helices) is a type of space curve, i.e. a smooth curve in three-dimensional space. It is characterised by the fact that the tangent line at any point makes a constant angle with a fixed line called the axis. Examples of helixes are coil springs and the handrails of spiral staircases. A "filled-in" helix for example, a spiral ramp is called a helicoid. Helices are important in biology, as the DNA molecule is formed as two intertwined helices, and many proteins have helical substructures, known as alpha helices. The word helix comes from the Greek word .

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.CubeVisual3D
member.summary: A Cube visual.

member.name: T:HelixToolkit.AnaglyphEffect
member.summary:
Anaglyph blending effect
Usage: 1. Add the effect to the RED UIElement. 2. Set CyanInput to a VisualBrush of the CYAN UIElement.
See AnalgyphView3D for an example on the usage.
